item.title: Katie add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "A sense of humor...is superior to any religion so far devised." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Katie add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "The highest function of love is that it makes the loved one a unique and irreplaceable being." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Katie add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Curiosity, especially intellectual inquisitiveness, is what separates the truly alive from those who are merely going through the motions." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Katie add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "You're better equipped for this world than I am," she said. "I'm always trying to change the world. You know how to live in it." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Katie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I still love books. Nothing a computer can do can compare to a book. You can't really put a book on the Internet. Three companies have offered to put books by me on the Net, and I said, 'If you can make something that has a nice jacket, nice paper with that nice smell, then we'll talk.' All the computer can give you is a manuscript. People don't want to read manuscripts. They want to read books. Books smell good. They look good. You can press it to your bosom. You can carry it in your pocket." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mitch Ratcliffe
item.description: "A computer lets you make more mistakes faster than any other invention with the possible exceptions of handguns and Tequila." -- Mitch Ratcliffe

item.title: Katie add a quote by Ian Stewart
item.description: "There are 10 kinds of people in the world: those who understand binary numerals, and those who don't." -- Ian Stewart

item.title: Katie add a quote by Robert Cringely
item.description: "If the automobile had followed the same development as the computer, a Rolls Royce would today cost $100, get a million miles per gallon, and explode once a year killing everyone inside. " -- Robert Cringely

item.title: Katie add a quote by Tom Jermoluk
item.description: "Forget UNIX - it will be gone in 5 years." -- Tom Jermoluk
